channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2024021541
item.description:
Report X-2024021541

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-17
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking by a package handler, manager called QA to pick up. QA put the package in a lined tote. DescribePack: Cap came loose during transit causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was kept in an upright position to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024020986
item.description:
Report X-2024020986

  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking on IC belt, QA was called to pick it up, package was put into a lined tote and spill pad was used to clean off IC belt. DescribePack: Cap came loose during handling causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a lined tote in an upright position and caps were tightened.

item.title: Report X-2024021069
item.description:
Report X-2024021069

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED FOUR 20 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FAULTLESS HEAVY FINISH IRONING SPRAY STARCH. THE CAPS COVERING THE AEROSOL NOZZELS WERE BROKEN CAUSING THE NOZZLES TO BE DEPRESSED DURING TRANSPORTATION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM A LOCATION IN CALIFORNIA, USA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 4V4424, MBE 34 ANOUDYL, 15 AVENUE DE NIMES, MONTPELLIER FRANCE 34000.

item.title: Report X-2024021072
item.description:
Report X-2024021072

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE MARKED AND LABELED AS CONSUMER COMMODITY ID8000 WITH A CLASS 9 DIAMOND LABEL AND SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE DANGEROUS GOODS SHIPMENT HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (1) 6.7 OUNCE BOTTLE OF RITUAL OF MEHR NOURISHING SHOWER OIL LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THE BLACK PUSH CAP WAS OPEN WHEN THEY INSPECTED THE PACKAGE WHICH CAUSED APPROXIMATELY 5 OUNCES TO LEAK TO THE EXTERIOR OF THE BOX. THE SECOND LEAKER WAS (1) 0.6 OUNCE THE RITUAL OF KARMA HAIR AND BODY MIST. THIS LEAKED APPROXIMATELY 0.3 OUNCES. THE CLEAR PLASTIC COVER FOR THE SPRAY NOZZLE WAS NOT ON WHEN THEY OPENED THE BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM THE NETHERLANDS GOING TO THE USA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B567J0, ARVATO BENELUX BV, BREM 1, HEIJEN NETHERLANDS 6598MH.

item.title: Report E-2024020468
item.description:
Report E-2024020468

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: PENDLETON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was starting his trip for the day and when doing his Pre-Trip noticed liquid on the floor of the trailer and called our emergency response line. Call was received at around 1115et. A team was dispatched and was in rout at 1230et, They arrived on scene at 1330et and started the process of getting information and dawning the appropriate PPE to begin the clean up. They had to remove several containers to get to the drum which was near the middle of a 53ft trailer. They found the drum and noted that it had a small hole in the side that the material was leaking out. The drum was put into a salvage drum and the material was cleaned up using absorbent materials and then disposed of properly. This was completed at approximately 1800et. The containers that had to be removed to gain excess were then reloaded and secured for shipment at 1900et.

item.title: Report X-2024021268
item.description:
Report X-2024021268

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024021268 AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, AN AIR PACKAGE FROM UNITED KINGDOM TO NEVADA, USA WAS INSPECTED DUE TO PREVIOUS UNDECLARED SHIPMENTS BEING FOUND BY IMPORT USA CBP AGENTS. PACKAGE INSPECTION REVEALS MEAL, READY TO EAT (MRE) WITH FLAMELESS RATION HEATERS CONTAINING MAGNESIUM POWDER, CARBON CLASSIFIED AS DANGEROUS WHEN WET. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS IMPORTED INTO THE USA FROM THE UNITED KINGDOM USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 418UTY, BAART OJRYNSKI, 2 2 P URDOM RD., WELWYM GARDEN C, AL74FH, UNITED KINGDOM. 2. X-2024021308 AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, AN AIR PACKAGE FROM UNITED KINGDOM TO ALASKA, USA WAS INSPECTED DUE TO PREVIOUS UNDECLARED SHIPMENTS BEING FOUND BY IMPORT USA CBP AGENTS. PACKAGE INSPECTION REVEALS MEAL, READY TO EAT (MRE) WITH FLAMELESS HEATERS CONTAINING MAGNESIUM POWDER, CARBON CLASSIFIED AS DANGEROUS WHEN WET. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS IMPORTED INTO THE USA FROM THE UNITED KINGDOM USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 417TDD, BAART OJRYNSKI, 2 2 P URDOM RD., WELWYM GARDEN C, AL74FH, UNITED KINGDOM. 3. X-2024021311 AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, AN AIR PACKAGE FROM UNITED KINGDOM TO NORTH DAKOTA, USA WAS INSPECTED DUE TO PREVIOUS UNDECLARED SHIPMENTS BEING FOUND BY IMPORT USA CBP AGENTS. PACKAGE INSPECTION REVEALS MEAL, READY TO EAT (MRE) WITH FLAMELESS RATION HEATERS CONTAINING MAGNESIUM POWDER, CARBON CLASSIFIED AS DANGEROUS WHEN WET. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS IMPORTED INTO THE USA FROM THE UNITED KINGDOM USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 41NHT3, BAART OJRYNSKI, 2 2 P URDOM RD., WELWYM GARDEN C, AL74FH, UNITED KINGDOM.

THE AGENT OPENED THE PACKAGE AND FOUND MEAL, READY TO EAT (MRE) WITH FLAMELESS RATION HEATERS CONTAINING MAGNESIUM POWDER, CARBON CLASSIFIED AS DANGEROUS WHEN WET. THE INVOICE WAS TREKKING SUPPLIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS EXPORTED FROM THE UNITED KINGDOM TO THE USA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 409WFT, BAART OJRYNSKI, 2 2 PURDOM RD., WEST GARDEN C, AL74FA, UNITED KINGDOM. 2. X-2024021238 AIR PACKAGE FROM THE UNITED KINGDOM TO TEXAS, USA WAS INSPECTED BY IMPORT USA CBP AGENTS AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY. THE AGENT OPENED THE PACKAGE AND FOUND MEAL, READY TO EAT (MRE) WITH FLAMELESS RATION HEATERS CONTAINING MAGNESIUM POWDER, CARBON CLASSIFIED AS DANGEROUS WHEN WET. THE INVOICE DESCRIPTION WAS TREKKING SUPPLIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS EXPORTED FROM THE UNITED KINGDOM TO THE USA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 41M5LT, BAART OJRYNSKI, 2 2 P URDOM RD., WELWYM GARDEN C, AL74FH, UNITED KINGDOM.

  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS CONSUMER COMMODITY ID8000 WITH A CLASS 9 DIAMOND LABEL, AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING, AND SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE DANGEROUS GOODS SHIPMENT HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE X 500 ML BOTTLE OF RITUALS PARFUM D'INTERIEUR RELAX INTERIOR PERFUME LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. APPROXIMATELY 400 ML HAD LEAKED. ADDITIONAL PRODUCTS INSIDE THE PACKAGE DID NOT LEAK. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM THE NETHERLANDS GOING TO THE USA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B567J0, ARVATO BENELUX BV, BREM 1, HEIJEN NETHERLANDS 6598MH.

item.title: Report X-2024021244
item.description:
Report X-2024021244

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS CONSUMER COMMODITY ID8000 WITH A CLASS 9 DIAMOND LABEL, AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING, AND SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THREE X 16.9 OUNCE BOTTLES OF WILD FIG HOME PERFUME. TWO OF THE BOTTLES HAD LEAKED FROM LOOSE CLOSURES. ONE BOTTLE DID NOT LEAK. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM THE NETHERLANDS GOING TO THE USA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B567J0, ARVATO BENELUX BV, BREM 1, HEIJEN NETHERLANDS 6598MH.

item.title: Report X-2024021242
item.description:
Report X-2024021242

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO (2) LEAKING DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGES MARKED AND LABELED AS CONSUMER COMMODITY ID8000 WITH CLASS 9 DIAMOND LABELS, AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKINGS, AND SHIPPERS DECLARATIONS. BOTH PACKAGES HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED ACCEPTANCE AUDITS AT THEIR ORIGIN FACILITIES IN THE NETHERLANDS. UPON INSPECTION OF TRACKING NUMBER 1ZB567J00459689513, ONE X 500 ML BOTTLE OF FLAMMABLE WILD FIG HOME PERFUME SPRAY WAS LEAKING FROM A LOOSE CLOSURE. UPON INSPECTION OF TRACKING NUMBER 1ZB567J00459689282, ONE X 6.7 OZ AEROSOL CAN OF RITUAL OF MEHR FOAMING SHOWER GEL HAD LEAKED FROM THE CLOSURE. THE SECOND PRODUCT LEAKING IN THE BOX WAS ONE X 3.3 OUNCE BOTTLE OF RITUALS OF MEHR DRY OIL FOR THE BODY LEAKING APPROXIMATELY ONE OUNCE FROM A LOOSE CLOSURE. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM THE NETHERLANDS GOING TO THE USA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B567J0, ARVATO BENELUX BV, BREM 1, HEIJEN NETHERLANDS 6598MH.

item.title: Report X-2024020805
item.description:
Report X-2024020805

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024020805: SequenceEvent: driver states packages were damaged prior to being loaded onto vehicle due to mishandling during the inbound sort. discovered by VSA at approximately 4:30PM promptly sectioned off area and proceeded begin damaged HazMat procedures. DescribePack: a pin sized hole on the bottom of the plastic container approximately ~1 centimeter in diameter DurationRel: 7 and MitigateEffect: quarantined immediate area promptly putting leaking packages into HazMat plastic lined salvage drums. X-2024020807: SequenceEvent: Driver states package was damaged before loading onto vehicle. package got damaged due to mishandling during the inbound sort. DescribePack: package leaking contents from pin sized hole in bottom of the container approximately ~1 centimeter in diameter. DurationRel: 7 and MitigateEffect: quarantined immediate area and put Amphomag onto spill area to neutralize acidic substances.

item.title: Report X-2024020838
item.description:
Report X-2024020838

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer door was not properly closed allowing package to fall out and for bottle inside to leak. Package was brought to QA after proper procedure for spill was followed by managers. DescribePack: Side of bottle was cracked allowing all of its contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a lined tote once it was in QA's possession.

item.title: Report X-2024020836
item.description:
Report X-2024020836

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to pick up a leaking hazmat on a newly opened trailer. Once QA arrived to the spill it was noted that the leaking hazmat was crushed due to being loaded in properly. IC's had crushed the package and allowed it to leak and damage another hazmat. Leaking hazmat was put into a lined tote, and non leaking hazmat was put into another tote. Neutralizer was used on leaked product. DescribePack: Package was crushed causing damage to two bottles causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in to a lined tote in an upright position.

item.title: Report X-2024020680
item.description:
Report X-2024020680

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to a leaking package. Package was found on dock with wet spots on it and was immediately put into a lined tote when QA arrived at spill. Product evaporated off floor before it could be wiped up. DescribePack: Caps were loose and allowing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was kept in an upright position in a lined tote and caps were tightened to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024020775

Report X-2024020775

DescribePack: Side of battery had sulfuric acid on it, unsure how battery was cracked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was kept in a lined tote.

This incident occurred at the CVG HUB, 236 Wendell H Ford Blvd, Erlanger KY 41018. Transportation by air has been confirmed.
